010package imagingbook.common.color.edge;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.awt.Point;
015import java.util.ArrayList;
016import java.util.List;
017import java.util.Stack;
018
019import ij.plugin.filter.Convolver;
020import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
021import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
022import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
023import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
024import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianKernel1D;
025import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
026import imagingbook.common.util.ParameterBundle;
027
028/**
029 * This class implements a Canny edge detector for grayscale and RGB images.
030 * The edge detector is "lazy" in the sense that it performs local non-
031 * maximum suppression and edge tracing only when the results are explicitly 
032 * queried (by the methods {@link #getEdgeBinary()} and {@link #getTraces()}).
033 * 
034 * @author W. Burger
035 * @version 2021/11/26
036 * @version 2022/03/22 added parameter annotations for dialogs
037 */
038public class CannyEdgeDetector extends ColorEdgeDetector {
039        
040        // TODO: Document methods, use arrays instead of image processors.
041        
042        public static class Parameters implements ParameterBundle {
043                
044                /** Gaussian sigma (scale, default = 2) */
045                @DialogLabel("Gaussian sigma (scale)")@DialogDigits(1)
046                public double gSigma = 2.0f;
047                
048                /** High threshold (defaults to 20% of maximum edge magnitude) */
049                @DialogLabel("High threshold (% of max. edge magnitude)")@DialogDigits(1)
050                public double hiThr  = 20.0f;
051                
052                /** Low threshold (defaults to 5% of maximum edge magnitude) */
053                @DialogLabel("Low threshold (% of max. edge magnitude)")@DialogDigits(1)
054                public double loThr = 5.0f;
055                
056                /** Set {@code true} to normalize gradient magnitude */
057                @DialogLabel("normalize gradient magnitude")
058                public boolean normGradMag = true;
059                
060                @Override
061                public boolean validate () { 
062                        return gSigma >= 0.1f && loThr < hiThr;
063                }
064        }
065        
066        private static final float CosPi8 = (float) Math.cos(Math.PI/8);
067        private static final float SinPi8 = (float) Math.sin(Math.PI/8);
068        
069        private final Parameters params;
070        private final int M, N;                                                 // width and height of I
071        
072        private FloatProcessor Emag = null;                             // gradient magnitude
073        private FloatProcessor Enms = null;                             // non-max suppressed gradient magnitude
074        private FloatProcessor Ex = null, Ey = null;    // edge normal vectors
075        private ByteProcessor  Ebin = null;                             // final (binary) edge map
076        private List<EdgeTrace> edgeTraces = null;              // list of edge traces
077        
078        
079        // Constructor with default parameters:
080        public CannyEdgeDetector(ImageProcessor ip) {
081                this(ip, new Parameters());
082        }
083        
084        // Constructor with parameter object:
085        public CannyEdgeDetector(ImageProcessor I, Parameters params) {
086                if (!params.validate()) throw new IllegalArgumentException();
087                this.params = params;
088                M = I.getWidth();
089                N = I.getHeight();
090                makeGradientsAndMagnitude(I);
091        }
092
093        //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
094        
095        // do the inital work only
096        private void makeGradientsAndMagnitude(ImageProcessor I) {
097                if (I instanceof ColorProcessor) 
098                        makeGradientsAndMagnitudeColor((ColorProcessor) I);
099                else
100                        makeGradientsAndMagnitudeGray(I);
101                //nonMaxSuppression();
102                //detectAndTraceEdges();
103        }
104
105        private void makeGradientsAndMagnitudeGray(ImageProcessor I) {          
106                FloatProcessor If = I.convertToFloatProcessor();        // always makes a copy
107                                
108                // apply a separable Gaussian filter to I
109                float[] gaussKernel = GaussianKernel1D.makeGaussKernel1D(params.gSigma);
110                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
111                conv.setNormalize(true);
112                conv.convolve(If, gaussKernel, gaussKernel.length, 1);
113                conv.convolve(If, gaussKernel, 1, gaussKernel.length);
114                
115                // calculate the gradients in X- and Y-direction
116                Ex = If;
117                Ey = (FloatProcessor) If.duplicate();
118                float[] gradKernel = {-0.5f, 0, 0.5f};
119                conv.setNormalize(false);
120                conv.convolve(Ex, gradKernel, gradKernel.length, 1);
121                conv.convolve(Ey, gradKernel, 1, gradKernel.length);
122                
123                Emag = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
124                float emax = 0;
125                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
126                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
127                                float dx = Ex.getf(u,v);
128                                float dy = Ey.getf(u,v);
129                                float mag = (float) Math.hypot(dx, dy); // = (float) Math.sqrt(dx*dx + dy*dy);
130                                if (mag > emax) 
131                                        emax = mag;
132                                Emag.setf(u, v, mag);
133                        }
134                }
135                
136                // normalize gradient magnitude 
137                if (params.normGradMag && emax > 0.001) 
138                        Emag.multiply(100.0/emax);
139        }
140        
141        private void makeGradientsAndMagnitudeColor(ColorProcessor I) {
142                FloatProcessor[] Irgb = rgbToFloatChannels(I);
143                FloatProcessor[] Ixrgb = new FloatProcessor[3];
144                FloatProcessor[] Iyrgb = new FloatProcessor[3];
145                
146                // apply a separable Gaussian filter to each RGB channel
147                float[] gaussKernel = GaussianKernel1D.makeGaussKernel1D(params.gSigma);
148                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
149                conv.setNormalize(true);
150                for (int i=0; i < Irgb.length; i++) {
151                        FloatProcessor If = Irgb[i];
152                        conv.convolve(If, gaussKernel, gaussKernel.length, 1);
153                        conv.convolve(If, gaussKernel, 1, gaussKernel.length);
154                        Ixrgb[i] = If;
155                        Iyrgb[i] = (FloatProcessor) If.duplicate();
156                }
157                
158                // calculate the gradients in X- and Y-direction for each RGB channel
159                float[] gradKernel = {-0.5f, 0, 0.5f};
160                conv.setNormalize(false);
161                for (int i = 0; i < Irgb.length; i++) {
162                        FloatProcessor Ix = Ixrgb[i];
163                        FloatProcessor Iy = Iyrgb[i];
164                        conv.convolve(Ix, gradKernel, gradKernel.length, 1);
165                        conv.convolve(Iy, gradKernel, 1, gradKernel.length);
166                }
167
168                // calculate gradient magnitude
169                Ex = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
170                Ey = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
171                Emag = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
172                
173                float emax = 0;
174                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
175                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
176                                float rx = Ixrgb[0].getf(u,v), ry = Iyrgb[0].getf(u,v);
177                                float gx = Ixrgb[1].getf(u,v), gy = Iyrgb[1].getf(u,v);
178                                float bx = Ixrgb[2].getf(u,v), by = Iyrgb[2].getf(u,v);
179                                float A = rx*rx + gx*gx + bx*bx;
180                                float B = ry*ry + gy*gy + by*by;
181                                float C = rx*ry + gx*gy + bx*by;
182                                
183//                              Eigensolver2x2 es = new Eigensolver2x2(A, C, C, B);
184//                              if (!es.isReal()) {
185//                                      throw new ArithmeticException(
186//                                                      String.format("No real eigenvalues for structure matrix at position (%d, %d)", u, v));
187//                              }
188//                              float mag = (float) Math.sqrt(es.getEigenvalue(0));
189//                              double[] eVec0 = es.getEigenvector(0);
190//                              Emag.setf(u, v, mag);
191//                              Ex.setf(u, v, (float) eVec0[0]);
192//                              Ey.setf(u, v, (float) eVec0[1]);
193                                
194                                float D = (float) Math.sqrt(sqr(A - B) + 4 * sqr(C));   
195                                float lambda0 = (A + B + D) / 2;                                                // eigenvalue \lambda_0
196                                Emag.setf(u, v, (float) Math.sqrt(lambda0));
197                                Ex.setf(u, v, A - B + D);                                                               // eigenvector x_0
198                                Ey.setf(u, v, 2 * C);                                                                   // eigenvector y_0
199                        }
200                }
201                // normalize gradient magnitude 
202                if (params.normGradMag && emax > 0.001) 
203                        Emag.multiply(100.0/emax);
204        }
205        
206        //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
207        
208        // perform non-maximum suppression along gradient direction
209        private void nonMaxSuppression() {
210                Enms = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
211                for (int v = 1; v < N - 1; v++) {
212                        for (int u = 1; u < M - 1; u++) {
213                                int s_theta = getOrientationSector(Ex.getf(u, v), Ey.getf(u, v));
214                                if (isLocalMaximum(Emag, u, v, s_theta, (float) params.loThr)) {
215                                        Enms.setf(u, v, Emag.getf(u, v)); // keep local maximum only
216                                }
217                        }
218                }
219        }
220        
221        private void detectAndTraceEdges() {
222                if (Enms == null) {
223                        nonMaxSuppression();
224                }
225                Ebin = new ByteProcessor(M, N);
226                int color = 255;
227                edgeTraces = new ArrayList<>();
228                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
229                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
230                                if (Enms.getf(u, v) >= params.hiThr && Ebin.get(u, v) == 0) { // unmarked edge point
231                                        EdgeTrace trace = traceAndThreshold(u, v, (float) params.loThr, color);
232                                        edgeTraces.add(trace);
233                                }
234                        }
235                }
236        }
237        
238        // Determines if the gradient magnitude is a local maximum at position (u,v)
239        // in direction s_theta.
240        private boolean isLocalMaximum(FloatProcessor gradMagnitude, int u, int v, int s_theta, float mMin) {
241                float mC = gradMagnitude.getf(u, v);
242                if (mC < mMin) {
243                        return false;
244                }
245                else {
246                        float mL = 0, mR = 0;
247                        switch (s_theta) {
248                        case 0 : 
249                                mL = gradMagnitude.getf(u-1, v);
250                                mR = gradMagnitude.getf(u+1, v);
251                                break;
252                        case 1 : 
253                                mL = gradMagnitude.getf(u-1, v-1);
254                                mR = gradMagnitude.getPixelValue(u+1, v+1);
255                                break;
256                        case 2 : 
257                                mL = gradMagnitude.getf(u, v-1);
258                                mR = gradMagnitude.getf(u, v+1);
259                                break;
260                        case 3 : 
261                                mL = gradMagnitude.getf(u-1, v+1);
262                                mR = gradMagnitude.getf(u+1, v-1);
263                                break;
264                        }
265                        return (mL <= mC && mC >= mR);
266                }
267        }
268        
269        /**
270         * Recursively collect and mark all pixels of an edge that are 8-connected to 
271         * (u0,v0) and have a gradient magnitude above loThr.
272         * @param u0 start coordinate (x)
273         * @param v0 start coordinate (y)
274         * @param loThr low threshold (min. edge magnitude to continue tracing)
275         * @param markVal value used for marking pixels on an edge trace
276         * @return a list of Point objects.
277         */
278        private EdgeTrace traceAndThreshold(int u0, int v0, float loThr, int markVal) {
279                //IJ.log("  working point " + u + " " + v);
280                Stack<PntInt> pointStack = new Stack<>();
281                EdgeTrace trace = new EdgeTrace();
282                pointStack.push(PntInt.from(u0, v0));
283                while (!pointStack.isEmpty()) {
284                        PntInt p = pointStack.pop();
285                        int up = p.x;
286                        int vp = p.y;
287                        Ebin.putPixel(up, vp, markVal); // mark this edge point
288                        trace.addPoint(p);
289                                
290                        int uL = Math.max(up - 1, 0);           // (up > 0) ? up-1 : 0;
291                        int uR = Math.min(up + 1, M - 1);       // (up < M-1) ? up+1 : M-1;
292                        int vT = Math.max(vp - 1, 0);           // (vp > 0) ? vp - 1 : 0;
293                        int vB = Math.min(vp + 1, N - 1);       // (vp < N-1) ? vp+1 : N-1;
294                        
295                        for (int u = uL; u <= uR; u++) {
296                                for (int v = vT; v <= vB; v++) {
297                                        if (Ebin.get(u, v) == 0 && Enms.getf(u, v) >= loThr) { 
298                                                pointStack.push(PntInt.from(u,v));
299                                        }
300                                }
301                        }
302                }
303                return trace;
304        }
305        
306
307        
308        // returns the quantized orientation sector for vector (dx, dy)
309        private int getOrientationSector(float dx, float dy) {
310                // rotate the gradient vector by PI/8
311                float dxR = CosPi8 * dx - SinPi8 * dy;
312                float dyR = SinPi8 * dx + CosPi8 * dy;  
313                // mirror vector (dxR,dyR) to [0,PI]
314                if (dyR < 0) {
315                        dxR = -dxR;
316                        dyR = -dyR;
317                }
318                // determine the octant for (dx, dy)
319                int s_theta;
320                if (dxR >= 0) { // dxR >= 0, dyR >= 0
321                        if (dxR >= dyR)
322                                s_theta = 0; // return 0;
323                        else
324                                s_theta = 1; // return 1;
325                }
326                else {  // dxR < 0, dyR >= 0
327                        if (-dxR < dyR)
328                                s_theta = 2; // return 2;
329                        else
330                                s_theta = 3; //return 3;
331                }
332                return s_theta;
333        }
334        
335        public FloatProcessor getEdgeMagnitude() {
336                return Emag;
337        }
338
339        public FloatProcessor getEdgeOrientation() {
340                FloatProcessor E_theta = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
341                for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
342                        for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
343                                double ex = Ex.getf(u, v);
344                                double ey = Ey.getf(u, v);
345                                float theta = (float) Math.atan2(ey, ex);
346                                E_theta.setf(u, v, theta);
347                        }
348                }
349                return E_theta;
350        }
351        
352        public ByteProcessor getEdgeBinary() {
353                if (Ebin == null) {
354                        detectAndTraceEdges();
355                }
356                return Ebin;
357        }
358        
359        public List<EdgeTrace> getTraces() {
360                if (edgeTraces == null) {
361                        detectAndTraceEdges();
362                }
363                return edgeTraces;
364        }
365        
366        @Deprecated             // will disappear in the future, use #getTraces() instead
367        public List<List<Point>> getEdgeTraces() {
368                if (edgeTraces == null) {
369                        detectAndTraceEdges();
370                }
371                List<List<Point>> traceListAwt = new ArrayList<>();
372                for (EdgeTrace trace : edgeTraces) {
373                        traceListAwt.add(trace.getAwtPoints());
374                }
375                return traceListAwt;
376        }
377        
378        //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
379        
380        // extract RGB channels of 'cp' as 3 float processors
381        private FloatProcessor[] rgbToFloatChannels(ColorProcessor cp) {
382                int w = cp.getWidth();
383                int h = cp.getHeight();
384                FloatProcessor rp = new FloatProcessor(w, h);
385                FloatProcessor gp = new FloatProcessor(w, h);
386                FloatProcessor bp = new FloatProcessor(w, h);
387                int[] pixels = (int[]) cp.getPixels(); 
388                float[] rpix = (float[]) rp.getPixels();
389                float[] gpix = (float[]) gp.getPixels();
390                float[] bpix = (float[]) bp.getPixels();
391                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
392                        int c = pixels[i];
393                        rpix[i] = (c & 0xff0000) >> 16;
394                        gpix[i] = (c & 0xff00) >> 8;
395                        bpix[i] = c & 0xff;
396                }
397        return new FloatProcessor[] {rp, gp, bp};
398        }
399        
400}
